dict.string: The Education Configuration Payload is designated by specifying com.apple.education as the PayloadType value. It can contain only one payload. The Education Configuration Payload defines the users, groups, and departments within an educational organization. It is supported on iOS 9.3 and later. On iOS, it must be supervised and sent over the device channel. It is supported on macOS 10.14 and later. On macOS, it must be sent over the user channel. Student payloads are only supported on macOS 10.14.4 and later.
The human-readable description of this payload. This description appears on the Detail screen.
The human-readable name for the profile payload. The name appears on the Detail screen and doesn't need to be unique.

The reverse-DNS-style identifier for the payload. This identifier is usually the same as the TopLevel value, with an additional appended component. This string must be unique within the profile. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The payload type, which each payload domain's reference page specifies.

The globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but must be globally unique. In macOS, use 'uuidgen' to generate UUIDs. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The version of this specific payload.
The human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provides the profile. This value doesn't need to match the organization payload value in the enclosing dictionary.
The organization's display name. This name is shown in the iOS login screen.

The organization's UUID identifier. This identifier can be any valid UUID. All teacher and student devices that need to communicate with one another must have the same organization UUID, particularly if they originated from different Device Enrollment Programs.

The UUID of an identity certificate payload within the same profile to use for performing client authentication with other devices. This property supports PKCS12 certificates. This key is required to configure Classroom. It does not impact the configuration of the Shared iPad login screen.

For shared iPad profiles: The array of dictionaries that defines which groups the user can select in the login window.
For leader/teacher profiles: The array of dictionaries that defines the groups that the user can control.
For member/student profiles: The array of dictionaries that defines the groups where the user is a member.
Required. The unsigned 16 bit integer specifying this group's unique beacon ID.
Required. The display name of the group.
Deprecated in iOS 9.3.1 and later. URL of an image for the group.
Optional. The source that provided this group; e.g. iTunesU, SIS, or MDM.
Optional. The user identifiers that are leaders of this group.
Required. The strings that refer to entries in the Users array that are members of the group.
Required. The identifier strings that refer to entries in the DeviceGroups array that are device groups to which the instructor can assign users from this class.

For shared iPad profiles: The array of dictionaries that define the users that are shown in the iOS login window.
For leader/teacher profiles: The array of dictionaries that define users that are members of the teacher's groups.
For member/student profiles: The array of dictionaries that must contain the definition of the user specified in the 'UserIdentifier' key. With one-to-one member devices, this key should include only the device user and the teacher but not other class members.
Required. The string that uniquely identifies a user in the organization.
Required. The string displayed as the name of the user.
Optional. The string displayed as the given name of the user.
Optional. The string displayed as the family name of the user.
Optional. The string that represents the userʼs phonetic given name. It will be used to sort users in the Classroom app and the Shared iPad Login Screen.
Optional. The string that represents the userʼs phonetic family name. It will be used to sort users in the Classroom app and the Shared iPad Login Screen.
URL pointing to a JPEG, PNG, or TIFF image of the user. Recommended either 256x256 or 512x512 resolution.

Optional. A string containing a URL pointing to an image of the user. This image will be displayed in the iOS login screen and in the Classroom app. The recommended resolution is 256 x 256 pixels (512 x 512 pixels on a 2x device). The recommended formats are JPEG, PNG, and TIFF. The ResourcePayloadCertificateUUID identity certificate or the MDM client identity will be used to perform authentication when fetching the image.

Deprecated in iOS 9.3.1 and later. URL pointing to an image of the user. The ResourcePayloadCertificateUUID identity certificate or the MDM client identity will be used to perform authentication when fetching the specified resource.
Optional. The Managed Apple ID for this user.
Optional. The passcode UI to show when the user is at the login window; possible values are complex, four, or six.

The array of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads within the same profile that are used to authorize leader peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Leader certificates must have the common name prefix leader (case insensitive). Note: This property doesn't support identity payloads or PKCS12 certificates. This key is required when configuring a student device for Classroom, and is ignored when configuring an instructor device. It does not impact the configuration of the Shared iPad login screen.

The array of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads within the same profile that are used to authorize group member peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Member certificates must have the common name prefix member (case insensitive). Note: This property doesn't support identity payloads or PKCS12 certificates. This key is required when configuring an instructor device for Classroom, and is ignored when configuring a student device. It does not impact the configuration of the Shared iPad login screen.

The UUID of an identity certificate payload within the same profile that is used to perform client authentication when fetching additional resources, such as student images. If not specified, the MDM client identity is used. If present, this key is used to configure both Classroom and the Shared iPad login screen.
The unique string that identifies the user of this device within the organization. If this payload is intended to configure the Shared iPad login screen, this value must not be set.

For shared iPad profiles: The array of dictionaries that defines which departments are shown in the Shared iPad login screen. If present, this key is used to configure both Classroom and the Shared iPad login screen.
Required. The display name of the department.
Required. The group beacon identifiers that are members of this department.
For leader/teacher profiles: The array of dictionaries that defines which device groups the leader can assign devices to. This key is not included in member payloads.
Required. The string that uniquely identifies the device group in the organization.
Required. The string displayed as the name of the device group, which must be unique in the organization.
The strings containing the serial numbers of the devices in the group.
Required. The strings containing the serial numbers of the devices in the group.
If 'true', allows students enrolled in managed classes to modify their teacher's permissions for screen observation on their device.
Allow students to modify screen observation permissions
